column4: guys I'm trying to mount a partition but I got an error message: 'ubuntu@ubuntu:/$ sudo chroot /mnt/hdb1 chroot: cannot run command `/bin/bash': No such file or directory'
what does that mean? this is the output from the fdisk -l command: http://paste.la/1258
are you sure bash is installed?
how can i be sure of that?
in terminal sudo apt-get install bash
hold on
Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree        Reading state information... Done bash is already the newest version. 0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
I'm out of ideas. could you give me some tip?
you can't mount /dev/hdb1?
nop
can you paste the /etc/fstab file?
chroot always returns `/bin/bash': No such file or directory. fstab has two lines
unionfs / unionfs rw 0 0 tmpfs /tmp tmpfs nosuid,nodev 0 0
are you on the livecd?
yeah
in terminal type sudo mkdir /mnt/disk then sudo mount /dev/hdb1 /mnt/disk then cd /mnt/disk
should I  umount the other existing ones?
terminal says hdb1 is already mounted
i don't hink you need to if your on livecd
i don't think you need to if your on livecd
type mount in terminal to see where its mounted
in terminal type sudo mkdir /mnt/disk then sudo mount /dev/hdb1 /mnt/disk then cd /mnt/disk
this is the output from the mount command: http://mibbit.com/pb/Zg6wZE
ok so cd /mnt/hdb1 then type dir to see files
